intro: Illecebrum lineare, commonly known as the creeping thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by bright red, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Illecebrum lineare is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
